description: MSM Industrial index ended higher by 0.48% today. His Majesty Sultan Haitham Bin Tarik issued a Royal Decree, No 61/ 2020, on the establishment of Oman Investment Institution. Article stipulates that a state department to be named " Oman Investment Institution" shall be established and that it shall have a legal identity, enjoy financial and administrative...
text:
Market Performance...

The MSM30 Index ended in red declining by 0.49% for the day at 3,517.60 points
amidst dull participation. MSM Industrial index ended higher by 0.48% today.
Financial, Services and Shariah index declined by 0.55%, 0.38% and 0.11%,
respectively for the day. A total of 3.563 million securities got traded
during the day amounting to an aggregate turnover of RO 1.395 million.
Activity in Sovereign Sukuk-1 accounted for c. 72% of today's turnover

(To view the original document, please click on the link below:

<http://reports.aiidatapro.com/brokers/GBCM/GBCMDailyMarketMonitor-4June2020.pdf>)

The adv: dec ratio for the day was at 3: 10 among the 27 traded counters.
Omani investors emerged as net buyers to an extent of RO 155K. Foreign and GCC
investors emerged as net sellers to an extent of RO 65K and 17K, respectively
for the day.

MSM30 Index Market Capitalization as at the end of the day stood at RO 4.368
billion and P/E and P/B are at 10.3X and 0.7X respectively, whereas overall
market capitalization (ex. bonds) is RO 5.823 billion and P/E and P/B are
11.4X and 0.8X respectively.

Oman News Watch...

His Majesty Sultan Haitham Bin Tarik issued a Royal Decree, No 61/2020, on the
establishment of Oman Investment Institution.

Article (1) stipulates that a state department to be named "Oman Investment
Institution" shall be established and that it shall have a legal identity,
enjoy financial and administrative autonomy and report to the Council of
Ministers.

Article (2) states that Oman Investment Institution shall have a board of
directors to be formed under a Royal order of His Majesty the Sultan.

Article (3) states that a Royal decree shall promulgate the system (law) of
Oman Investment Institution.

Article (4) states that all specializations, allocations, rights, obligations,
registers, assets and investments related to the State's General Reserve Fund
shall be transferred to Oman Investment Institution, and so shall Oman
Investment Fund and the Directorate General of Investments at Ministry of
Finance. Also, all employees of the SGRF and OIF shall be transferred to Oman
Investment Institution, along with their current job status and financial
dues. (Source: ONA, Oman Observer)

Regional News Watch...

National Gas and Industrialization Co. (GASCO) reported net profit after Zakat
and tax of SAR 33.4 million for Q1 2020, a decline of 63.66% year-on-year
(YoY), driven by lower revenue from investments, higher selling and marketing
expenses, and increased general and administrative expenses. On a sequential
basis, GASCO swung to profit in Q1 20, versus losses of SAR 19.5 million in Q4
2019. (Source: Argaam) AXA Cooperative Ins. Co. reported a net profit before
zakat of SAR 35.3 million for Q1 2020, a rise of 31.6% year-on-year (YoY). The
profit rise was attributed to an increase in surplus from insurance operations
mainly due to improvement in property and casualty segment, along with
improved policy and shareholder's investment income. (Source: Argaam)

Saudi Industrial Development Co. (SIDC) reported a net loss after Zakat of SAR
10 million for Q1 2020, from a net profit of SAR 3 million, a year earlier.
The net loss was attributed to higher operating losses affected by lower sales
in addition to realizing non-operating losses.When compared to previous
quarter, net loss after Zakat narrowed over 72-fold on lower operating
expenses. {Source: Argaam)

Etihad Airways has confirmed that salary reductions which were in place as a
result of the Covid-19 pandemic will remain in effect until September.
"Regretfully, Etihad has extended its salary reduction until September 2020,
with 25% reduction for junior staff and cabin crew, and 50% for employees at
manager level and above. Housing allowance and a number of benefits continue
to be paid," an Etihad Aviation Group spokesperson confirmed. (Source: Gulf
Business)

Looking Ahead:

Sideways trend may prevail, overall market volumes may remain dull during
Summer...

***

title: GBCM Research - Daily Market Monitor report - Jun 4, 2020
html:
Market Performance...

The MSM30 Index ended in red declining by 0.49% for the day at 3,517.60 points amidst dull participation. MSM Industrial index ended higher by 0.48% today. Financial, Services and Shariah index declined by 0.55%, 0.38% and 0.11%, respectively for the day. A total of 3.563 million securities got traded during the day amounting to an aggregate turnover of RO 1.395 million. Activity in Sovereign Sukuk-1 accounted for c. 72% of today's turnover

(To view the original document, please click on the link below:

http://reports.aiidatapro.com/brokers/GBCM/GBCMDailyMarketMonitor-4June2020.pdf) 

The adv: dec ratio for the day was at 3: 10 among the 27 traded counters. Omani investors emerged as net buyers to an extent of RO 155K. Foreign and GCC investors emerged as net sellers to an extent of RO 65K and 17K, respectively for the day.

MSM30 Index Market Capitalization as at the end of the day stood at RO 4.368 billion and P/E and P/B are at 10.3X and 0.7X respectively, whereas overall market capitalization (ex. bonds) is RO 5.823 billion and P/E and P/B are 11.4X and 0.8X respectively.

Oman News Watch...

His Majesty Sultan Haitham Bin Tarik issued a Royal Decree, No 61/2020, on the establishment of Oman Investment Institution.

Article (1) stipulates that a state department to be named "Oman Investment Institution" shall be established and that it shall have a legal identity, enjoy financial and administrative autonomy and report to the Council of Ministers.

Article (2) states that Oman Investment Institution shall have a board of directors to be formed under a Royal order of His Majesty the Sultan.

Article (3) states that a Royal decree shall promulgate the system (law) of Oman Investment Institution.

Article (4) states that all specializations, allocations, rights, obligations, registers, assets and investments related to the State's General Reserve Fund shall be transferred to Oman Investment Institution, and so shall Oman Investment Fund and the Directorate General of Investments at Ministry of Finance. Also, all employees of the SGRF and OIF shall be transferred to Oman Investment Institution, along with their current job status and financial dues. (Source: ONA, Oman Observer)

Regional News Watch...

National Gas and Industrialization Co. (GASCO) reported net profit after Zakat and tax of SAR 33.4 million for Q1 2020, a decline of 63.66% year-on-year (YoY), driven by lower revenue from investments, higher selling and marketing expenses, and increased general and administrative expenses. On a sequential basis, GASCO swung to profit in Q1 20, versus losses of SAR 19.5 million in Q4 2019. (Source: Argaam) AXA Cooperative Ins. Co. reported a net profit before zakat of SAR 35.3 million for Q1 2020, a rise of 31.6% year-on-year (YoY). The profit rise was attributed to an increase in surplus from insurance operations mainly due to improvement in property and casualty segment, along with improved policy and shareholder's investment income. (Source: Argaam)

Saudi Industrial Development Co. (SIDC) reported a net loss after Zakat of SAR 10 million for Q1 2020, from a net profit of SAR 3 million, a year earlier. The net loss was attributed to higher operating losses affected by lower sales in addition to realizing non-operating losses.When compared to previous quarter, net loss after Zakat narrowed over 72-fold on lower operating expenses. {Source: Argaam)

Etihad Airways has confirmed that salary reductions which were in place as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic will remain in effect until September. "Regretfully, Etihad has extended its salary reduction until September 2020, with 25% reduction for junior staff and cabin crew, and 50% for employees at manager level and above. Housing allowance and a number of benefits continue to be paid," an Etihad Aviation Group spokesperson confirmed. (Source: Gulf Business)

Looking Ahead:

Sideways trend may prevail, overall market volumes may remain dull during Summer...

***
